definition: a large deer with long antlers (= hard parts on the head that are like branches), that lives in cold northern regions
a machine that is designed to do a particular thing in the home, such as preparing food, heating or cleaning
the fact of being true or useful in a particular case or situation
that can be said to be true in the case of somebody/something
a person who makes a formal request for something (= applies for it), especially for a job, a place at a college or university, etc.
the use of a noun phrase immediately after or before another noun phrase that refers to the same person or thing
to consider or examine somebody/something and form an opinion about them or it
to officially examine a building, an object, etc. and say how much it is worth
to make a formal judgement about the value of a person’s work, usually after a discussion with them about it
a person whose job is to examine a building, an object, etc. and say how much it is worth
a person who makes a formal judgement about the value of a person's work, usually after discussion with them about it
large enough to be noticed or thought important
suitable for marriage
young and sexually attractive
relating to the jejunum (= the second part of the small intestine)
the second part of the small intestine
feeling or showing that you are grateful for something
showing pleasure
a young person who works for an employer for a fixed period of time in order to learn the particular skills needed in their job
a piece of clothing worn over the front of the body, from the chest or the waist down, and tied around the waist. Aprons are worn over other clothes to keep them clean, for example when cooking.
an area with a hard surface at an airport, where aircraft are turned around, loaded, etc.
the part of the stage that is in front of the curtain
(too much under) the influence and control of somebody
a large glass container in which fish and other water creatures and plants are kept
a building where people can go to see fish and other water creatures
an angel of the highest rank
connected with the study of cultures of the past and of periods of history by examining the parts of buildings and objects found in the ground
a thing that is very old or old-fashioned, especially a word or a style of language or art; the use of such a word or style
a bishop of the highest rank, responsible for all the churches in a large area
(in the past) a son of the Emperor of Austria
(in some European countries but not the UK) a nobleman of high rank between a count and a duke
(in the UK) a nobleman of high rank between an earl and a duke
the art or sport of shooting arrows with a bow
the most typical or perfect example of a particular kind of person or thing
a person whose job is to develop and manage an archive
very enthusiastic and showing strong feelings about something/somebody
very strong feelings of enthusiasm or love
that you can give good reasons for
not certain; that you do not accept without question
a nobleman of the lowest rank. In the UK, barons use the title Lord; in other countries they use the title Baron.
a person who owns or controls a large part of a particular industry
(in the UK) a nobleman of a rank below an earl and above a baron
a kitchen tool for removing the zest from oranges, lemons, etc.
a unit for measuring electrical power; one million watts
(in some countries) people born in the highest social class, who have special titles
having little or no rain; very dry
with nothing new or interesting in it
the fact of having little or no rain; the fact of being very dry
the fact of having or containing nothing new or interesting
a plant with a long root that is cooked and eaten as a vegetable
an American animal with a hard shell made of pieces of bone
the place in a coat, shirt, dress, etc. that your arm goes through
protected by metal covers
using armoured vehicles
a person who makes or repairs weapons and armour
the part of the body under the arm where it joins the shoulder
the most unpleasant or ugly place in a country or region
a place where weapons and armour are kept
(in the US or Canada) a building that is the headquarters for training people who are not professional soldiers, for example the National Guard
the things that somebody has available to help them achieve something
all the weapons and military equipment that a country has
to bring somebody to court in order to formally accuse them of a crime
a small brown bird with a pleasant song
a thing that you do for fun or as a joke
an activity that you think is a waste of time or that you do not take seriously
to get out of bed very early in the morning
used by somebody who does not want to do something because it involves too much effort
the sharp pointed end of an arrow
the crime of deliberately setting fire to something, especially a building
very great
extremely good
a person who commits the crime of arson
